name: Reina - Chess thru a Keyhole v1
description: first Reina attempt. trying to play chess and keyhole at the same time. too much? suggestions?

name: Rihanna exposed
description:
I'm new to the netrunner world but I've been getting my feet wet and I really want to see if silhouette will be any good.

That being said, I'm really just looking for some feedback. I've always liked control decks (came from magic) and I think if built right, this deck could do it.

My early runs would hopefully score some points and get good tempo. I might really suffer the mid game but I'm hoping Kati jones and black guard will really get me home.

This deck is modeled more after heartthrobs blackguard of the red queen deck(shout out to him). I'm really hoping to put a lot of pressure on Hq and just keep me in their hand the whole time. I wanted to include nerve agent in here but I'm not sure what to take out. Modded seems like it would save me lots of time and money but 6 influence and 3 slots in a 40 card deck is hefty. Thoughts? I like levy at lab access... One of my favorite cards and I could replace modded and include a different card in the third slot.

The other major concern is that I only have 1 copy of each ice breaker. I was thinking of dropping special order and other events to include two of each. Alias, Breach, and passport will hopefully keep me in HQ to snipe some agendas and give me time to check what's being setup in remotes while blackguard and other ice breakers are being out out.

I'm thinking this will be a fun deck for me but I looking for suggestions and help from you pros out there. Thanks!

description: Frack runners, get money Get money, frack runners

description: Wraparounds make me sick!! I had to insert some corroders only for wraparounds, and anarch is the only faction that has no icebreaker-searching method...

name: Credits for Charon
description: Fairly straightforward: install pop-up window in front of the central servers to get cash from the Runner, use it to kill hir.

name: NBN Fast Advance and Nasty Ice
description: Slow te runner down with nasty ice. Get Sansan back with interns and Jacko.

name: Reina Blackguard
description: Rough and untested! Taking it to a meet up tonight to test and refine. Any feedback welcome!

name: Reina Toolbox
description: Lots of solutions for every problem! Parasite recursion, efficient breakers, lots of moneys, Keyholes!

name: Remoteless
description: An updated version of my remoteless deck. Double biotic the efficiency committee and then san san ship the rest. biotic profiteering for emergency credit gap

name: To Waste Inordinate Yen (TWIY)
description: Here is an untested as of yet recreation of my old waste your money deck. Make trashing and getting through stuff really taxing and hopefully have enough money every turn to advance on your rsvp protected san san. get that astrochain running

name: Perhaps More Naughty Than Nice
description:
Based on tacullu's "Nice or Naughty" decks.

The concept is simple: only run on the Corp using Blackmail, and they can (usually) never rez ice.

Play Aesop's Pawnshop, New Angeles City Hall, and Activist Support. Prevent your tag; Aesop the Activist Support away after the Corp has taken their Bad Publicity. This guarantees that you can Blackmail to your heart's content.

With Same Old Thing and Levy AR Lab Access, you can potentially Blackmail 18 times in a game—though, hopefully, you won't have to.

This is the version that I'm testing now; I've added Mr. Li, Kati Jones, and John Masanori to help with economy and card draw. Hostage allows me to run only one of each (as well as only one copy of The Source to deal with Fast Advance decks).

Economy in the deck is sparse: Sure Gamble is supported by Magnum Opus and Kati Jones. In testing, this is enough.

Crypsis is in the deck to help in the rare situation where the Corp can rez ice (say, through scoring an Accelerated Beta Test). Deus X is to protect against Jinteki traps.

Adding the Hostages means I have to lose out on HQ Interface, but I'm not sure where I'd free up more influence.

name: Turn of the Sentry.
description:
20 Sentry Ice. No, not kidding.

This is a concept icebreaker hell deck. With only 9 sentry breakers currently in the game and a lot of decks using tricks to get through those pesky sentry ice...I thought a deck only made up of sentry ice would present a unique problem for the runner.

You'll need money and you'll need to install a lot of ice...it's almost glacier-style HB but the ice are all just punishing. One-shot sentry breakers will not work against the deck, and you should have a Corporate Troubleshooter and cash ready if you see an AI-breaker deck or a Garrote. Pump something during the run to trash those suckers! Also, there are plenty of ETR sentries in here.

With NBN and Weyland sentries splashed, this becomes a very dangerous deck to run against. To give Mimic headaches there are sufficient 4+ strength ice. This is an ice-nightmare deck, so the win-strategy is to hurt them early and keep their rig too damaged to run or keep them scared so that you can quickly get your agendas through. Biotics for the fast end-game if they figure out a way through the sentry gauntlets...

In our current A:NR world of Fast Advance and Kill Combos this might be a different approach to corp shenanigans. A lot of decks will be left with lots of dead draws against this deck (code gate breakers, barrier breakers, and tutors.)

Also, I love decks that can use ABT's ability when they score it. 2x Jack Ho lets you get away with that safely.

name: You have an e-mail ... a black mail
description: A deck bases on the black mail card. No breakers only ressources and event

name: Andy E&D (Expose and Derez)
description: Oblige the Corp to rez Ice (at higher cost) with Blackguard plus expose cards and derez the ICE with Emergency Shutdown/Crescentus or trash it with Forged Activation Orders. Levy AR Lab Acess to recycle the events and Crescentus.

name: Experimental Reina v 0.3
description:
Inspired by: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/2678/gamers-den-2014-store-champion-1st-place-deck

Assisted by fortranmaker.

-2 Aesops, -3 Daily Casts, -2 Datasucker +2 Hostage, +1 Kati Jones, +1 Professional Contacts, +3 Deja Vu, +2 Parasite

name: Boardroom Blitz (v1.3)
description:
After a lengthy back and forth with Lysander as he was developing his Astrobiotics list, I managed to get mine down to 40 cards. I kept Jackson around because there are Noise players in my meta, but you can cut 2x Jackson for Shipment from SanSan, Enigma, or Chimera.

I stuck with 3x Biotic Labor because I always want to have one in hand. That way my SanSan City Grids are pure Runner tax, rezzed only if the Runner declines to trash them -- basically if they can't afford it. If left around, it's easy to score a Profiteering for 10c and set up the next Beale. (This assumes you have failed to get on the Astrotrain; if you're on the Astrotrain, just ride that to victory -- it's definitely Plan A.)

Tollbooth is the emergency protection against R&D lock, or ice for a scoring remote against non-Criminals if you get in a position where you have to create one.

As always, time your Grim rezzes very carefully. The bad pub adds up; if it isn't going to open a scoring window, don't do it.
